titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 673) to authorize the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to make grants to the Florida Keys Aqueduct Authority and other appropriate agencies for the purpose of improving water quality throughout the marine ecosystem of the Florida Keys.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-601, by Mr. Diaz-Balart.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 673 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. It shall be in order to consider as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five-minute rule the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure now printed in the bill. Measure will be considered read. Bill is open to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 214.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 483.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/2/2000--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (open) for the consideration of H.R. 673 (authorizing grants to the Florida Keys Aqueduct Authority for water quality control).
